an10.76:4.1: “Mendicants, if three things were not found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching and training announced by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
an10.76:4.4: If these three things were not found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha would not arise in the world, and the teaching and training announced by the Realized One would not shine in the world.
an10.76:4.5: But since these three things are found, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arises in the world, and the teaching and training announced by the Realized One shines in the world.

an10.76:14.1: Mendicants, someone who lacks conscience and prudence is negligent.
an10.76:14.2: When you’re negligent you can’t give up disrespect, being hard to correct, and bad friendship.
an10.76:14.3: When you’ve got bad friends you can’t give up faithlessness, miserliness, and laziness.
an10.76:14.4: When you’re lazy you can’t give up restlessness, lack of restraint, and unethical conduct.
an10.76:14.5: When you’re unethical you can’t give not wanting to see the noble ones, not wanting to hear the teaching of the noble ones, and a fault-finding mind.
an10.76:14.6: When you’ve got a fault-finding mind you can’t give up unmindfulness, lack of situational awareness, and a scattered mind.
an10.76:14.7: When your mind is scattered you can’t give up focusing your mind in the wrong way, following a wrong path, and mental sluggishness.
an10.76:14.8: When your mind is sluggish you can’t give up identity view, doubt, and mistaking the point of precepts and observances.
an10.76:14.9: When you have doubts you can’t give up greed, hate, and delusion.
an10.76:14.10: Without giving up greed, hate, and delusion you can’t give up birth, old age, and death.

an10.76:24.9: When you have no doubts you can give up greed, hate, and delusion.
an10.76:24.10: After giving up greed, hate, and delusion you can give up birth, old age, and death.”
